main.commit_message:
build: harden main.yml permissions

Signed-off-by: Alex <aleksandrosansan@gmail.com>

Merge pull request #1757 from kcooney/eclipse-maven

Recommend generating Eclipse project files with Maven
Recommend generating Eclipse project files with Maven

Merge pull request #1755 from kcooney/kcooney-email

Update email address for kcooney in pom.xml
Update email address for kcooney in pom.xml

Merge pull request #1753 from kluever/patch-3

Fix unused object creation in WithParameterSupplier

Update WithParameterSupplier.java

Capture unused Theories creation into an unused variable (ErrorProne's CheckReturnValue can be configured to require all constructor calls to be used).

Merge pull request #1749 from cpovirk/noforeach

Use an indexed for loop to avoid defining an unused variable.

Merge pull request #1719 from kluever/patch-2

Fix "ReturnValueIgnored" errors flagged by error-prone

* Update AssertTest.java to use `assertNotNull()` on places where the return value of `e.getMessage()` is ignored

Merge pull request #1740 from junit-team/marc/1739-fix-compile-error-on-jdk-18

Fix compile error on JDK 18 and later

Update AssertTest.java

Use `assertNotNull()` instead.
Add a comment.
Use an indexed for loop to avoid defining an unused variable.
Allow running single test class from Maven via -Dtest=
Remove usage of deprecated-for-removal SecurityManager
Add CO build for JDK 18

Fix compile error on JDK 18 and later

Resolves #1739.

Revert "Update Maven to 3.8.5"

This reverts commit 543f60a9874f89c972b77c4160354358c4cbef2f.
Use Maven wrapper compatible with JDK 6
Update Maven to 3.8.5

Merge pull request #1732 from cpoerschke/main-reduce-warnings-multi-commit

Address some warnings (in 4 parts)
code review feedback: reduce scope of the 'unchecked cast' warning fix a.k.a. @SuppressWarnings('unchecked')
fix JavaDoc warnings [unchecked cast]
fix JavaDoc warnings [no description for @param]
fix JavaDoc warnings [no description for @throws]
remove usages of deprecated org.junit.Assert.assertThat()
Fix "ReturnValueIgnored" errors flagged by error-prone

Use Java 8 for publishing snapshots

To work around SSL problems, the build now uses Java 8 for the job that publishes snapshots to oss.sonatype.org.
Update build matrix to use GA version of JDK 17

Fix dead link to the Ant task in faq.fml

URL http://ant.apache.org/manual/OptionalTasks/junit.html is dead.  Use
up-to-date URL for documentation of Ant's JUnit task in file 'faq.fml'.
This is similar to commit 24dfdd76 (Fix dead link to the ant task in FAQ
(#1478), 2017-08-08).
Test against JDK 16
Use setup-java's Maven cache and use Temurin JDK distribution

Add security policy

Closes #1711.
Change version to 4.13.3-SNAPSHOT
Link to 4.13.2 release notes
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release r4.13.2
Add build for JDK 17-ea

Improve check that thread is stopped

The new code is hopefully easier to understand because it makes it
explicit that it checks that the statement is stopped within a period
of time that is close to the timeout.

Merge test for exception type and message

IMO this is conceptually one assert because the message and the
exception type are strongly coupled.
Rename DelegateStatement to DelegatingStatement
Better name for test that stops statement

Replace InfiniteLoop with RunForASecond

RunForASecond finally stops and therefore avoids that we create
background threads that run forever.

Tidy up FailOnTimeoutTest

Improve readability and reusability. When I started to read the test it
took me some time to understand it. The reason was the configurable
statement TestStatement and the evaluateWith... methods. The refactored
test uses fixed Statements when possible and uses smaller methods for
wrapping FailOnTimeout with a ThrowingRunnable and for wrapping an
arbitrary statement with a FailOnTimeout. It also calls
FailOnTimeout#evaluate directly when possible.
Update 4.13.2 release notes to document pull 1654

Fix serialization of AssumptionViolatedException (#1654)

Added serializable descriptions of values and matchers and use them in writeObject() serialization of AssumptionViolatedException.

Fixes #1192

Only create ThreadGroups if FailOnTimeout.lookForStuckThread is true. (#1691)

This reduces the differences (where possible) when tests are run with a timeout.
Creating a ThreadGroup can cause noticeable differences, for example in code
that uses java.beans.ThreadGroupContext.

Extract sample test classes from StackTracesTest

Follow Kevin's idea from ead2fe7ca97e4b0bc013efe0e734e39a45db213c up
that sample test classes are stored in a specific container.

Reordering the modifiers to comply with the JLS:

* Java Language Specification

Clean up imports

* Same package classes are always implicitly imported
* Remove unused imports
Remove commented out code

Initial release notes for 4.13.2 (#1692)

* Initial release notes for 4.13.2

Co-authored-by: Marc Philipp <marc@gradle.com>

Mark ThreadGroups created by FailOnTimeout as daemon groups (#1687)

Mark ThreadGroup created by FailOnTimeout as a daemon group.

Previously, FailOnTimeout destroyed the ThreadGroup, which could cause race conditions if the ThreadGroup was referenced by other threads.

Fixes #1652
Update POM to reflect changed CI system
Delete Travis config and badge
Add GH Actions workflow
Fix build for Java 12 and above

Fix tests for floating point assertions (#1673)

Since `assertEquals(1.0, 2.0, 0.0)` and `fail()` both throw
AssertionFailedErrors these tests were not actually testing anything.
Document security fix in release notes
Update Version.java
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration

marc/1739-fix-compile-error-on-jdk-18.commit_message: Allow running single test class from Maven via -Dtest=
Remove usage of deprecated-for-removal SecurityManager
Add CO build for JDK 18

Fix compile error on JDK 18 and later

Resolves #1739.

Revert "Update Maven to 3.8.5"

This reverts commit 543f60a9874f89c972b77c4160354358c4cbef2f.
Use Maven wrapper compatible with JDK 6
Update Maven to 3.8.5

(#1478), 2017-08-08).
Test against JDK 16
Use setup-java's Maven cache and use Temurin JDK distribution

Add security policy

Closes #1711.
Change version to 4.13.3-SNAPSHOT

[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release r4.13.2

The new code is hopefully easier to understand because it makes it
explicit that it checks that the statement is stopped within a period
of time that is close to the timeout.

IMO this is conceptually one assert because the message and the

RunForASecond finally stops and therefore avoids that we create
background threads that run forever.

Tidy up FailOnTimeoutTest

Improve readability and reusability. When I started to read the test it
took me some time to understand it. The reason was the configurable

Fix serialization of AssumptionViolatedException (#1654)

Added serializable descriptions of values and matchers and use them in writeObject() serialization of AssumptionViolatedException.

Fixes #1192

This reduces the differences (where possible) when tests are run with a timeout.
Creating a ThreadGroup can cause noticeable differences, for example in code

* Java Language Specification

* Same package classes are always implicitly imported
* Remove unused imports
Remove commented out code

Initial release notes for 4.13.2 (#1692)

* Initial release notes for 4.13.2

Co-authored-by: Marc Philipp <marc@gradle.com>

Mark ThreadGroups created by FailOnTimeout as daemon groups (#1687)

Mark ThreadGroup created by FailOnTimeout as a daemon group.

Previously, FailOnTimeout destroyed the ThreadGroup, which could cause race conditions if the ThreadGroup was referenced by other threads.

Fixes #1652
